message.content:
cs.CY, cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CR, cs.SI 

The paper proposes a methodology to measure the effectiveness of academic recruitment and turnover in terms of research performance, which is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science. The sub-category of "cs.CY" (Computers and Society) is likely the most relevant as the paper discusses the potential impact of monitoring recruitment and turnover on deterring favoritism. The sub-category of "cs.DL" (Digital Libraries) is also relevant as the paper discusses the analysis of data from Italian universities over a period of time. The sub-categories of "cs.IR" (Information Retrieval) and "cs.CR" (Cryptography and Security) are relevant as the paper discusses the correlation between different indicators of effectiveness and overall research performance. Finally, the sub-category of "cs.SI" (Social and Information Networks) is relevant as the paper discusses the potential impact of recruitment and turnover on research performance.
